title: Understanding File Explorer
text: To copy files, you first need to open the File Explorer. This is where you can view and manage your files and folders.

title: Navigating to the Files
text: Once the File Explorer is open, navigate to the location where your data files are stored. This could be in a specific folder or directory.

title: Selecting the Files
text: Select the files you want to copy. You can do this by clicking on them. To select multiple files, hold down the 'Ctrl' key while clicking each file.

title: Copying the Files
text: After selecting the files, right-click and choose 'Copy' from the context menu. Alternatively, you can press $$'Ctrl+C'$$ on your keyboard.

title: Pasting the Files
text: Navigate to the new location where you want to place the files. Right-click in the folder and select 'Paste' from the context menu, or press $$'Ctrl+V'$$.

hintAnswer: click the file explorer button to open a file explorer window; navigate to the location of the data files, select the data files, and $$copy-paste$$ the files into the new folder
title: Copying Data Files
text: Follow these steps to copy data files to a new location: $$1$$. Open File Explorer. $$2$$. Navigate to the data files. $$3$$. Select the files. $$4$$. Copy the files. $$5$$. Navigate to the new location. $$6$$. Paste the files.
choices: click the file explorer button to open a file explorer window; navigate to the location of the data files, select the data files, and $$copy-paste$$ the files into the new folder
click on the name of the file, $$copy-paste$$ it, and navigate into the new folder
click the file explorer button to open a file explorer window, then click the file and drag and drop them to the folder
